content.description: Crux involves a few start moves then easier climbing to top it out.
content.location: Start just 5 feet left of the arete. See photos for specifics!

content.description:
Climb starts as a sit start, just inside the cave opening, then the line moves out and left then straight up to the top, following a line of jugs. Suggest a spotter for this one, some rocks litter the landing area. Also, one of the jugs inside the cave is thin so use the better part of the hold for a secure undercling.

 A second start option involves beginning as far back as possible, keeping your feet off the ground and pressed against the side walls and hands pressed for confined stemming. Continue out following the basic sit start option. (V0-)
content.location: This line comes out of the obvious small cave opening, at the far north end of the bluff line. Climb starts as a sit start, just inside the cave opening, then the line moves out and left then straight up to the top, following a line of jugs.

content.description: Climb the front section of taller, clean rock and step off of the short backside of the Mini Spire.  [BG 52 & 53]
content.protection: Pad, Spotter, large pile of stuffed animals!
content.location: Left side of The Den area, which is the furthest most north section of the Robinson Bluff exposure.

content.description: Lower crux leads to jugs for a finish top-out.  [BG 54]
content.location: Start just left of Seam of Dreams, continuing straight up. Better to climb during drier season months. See photos

content.description:
Start all the way back in the small cave.

 This start involves, beginning as far back as possible, keeping your feet off the ground, pressed against the side walls and hands pressed for confined stemming. (V0)  Now, just inside the cave opening, the line moves out and straight up to the top, following a line of jugs. (V0-) Suggest a spotter for this one, some rocks litter the landing area. Also, one of the jugs inside the cave is thin so use the better part of the hold for a secure undercling.
content.location: This line comes out of the obvious small cave opening, at the far north end of the bluff line. To get there, follow the Boulder Ridge Trail down from the campground. Small cave is on the north end of the Den area, where the ridge trail meets the base trail turn. Climb starts as a sit start, as far back in the cave as possible, moving towards the opening. Then the line moves out and straight up to the top, following a line of jugs.

content.description: Pocket jugs in the corner of The Den still needs some cleaning but has the potential for being another great warm-up.  [BG 54]
content.location: Corner of The Den area, left of Juggernaut.

content.description: This sit start follows a sequence of pockets vertically along The Den's rounded arete. Sequence is important for following the easiest path to the top. If it feels harder, try to rework the handhold sequence. The holds get bigger the higher you climb. Jug finished allows you to stand on the top.
content.location: Take a trail to The Den Area and find the small cave opening. Roughly 12 feet left of the small cave, a rounded, pocket riddled arete can not be missed. Start sitting below, using small pockets and edges.

content.description:
The Den is the last section of exposed rock which forms boulder like formations. A variety a problems offer relatively good landing zones for pads and a diversity of line styles.

Bouldering Problems are roughly 15 ft tall and provide a diversity from easy to difficult (range from V easy to V5).

Ratings: While easier climbs are given a rating number representing the problem to be no harder than the rating represented, lines rated V0 (5.10) and up are given a specific max crux rating. This should help you plan your visit and navigate your way along the bluff while using Mountain Project. See the scale below to help understand route difficult conversion.

Please provide feedback using your MP App. Star rating and rate difficulty feedback helps the next visitors use the app.

Rating Scale:

V Scale        YDS       GYM

                    = 5.3 Descent      = 5.4         VB5             = 5.5       5.7 (VB) VB6             = 5.6       VB7             = 5.7       5.9 (V0) VB8             = 5.8       VB9             = 5.9        5.10 (V1) V0-              = 5.9+       V0               = 5.10      5.10 (V3) V0+             = 5.10+                                         V1               = 5.11a V2               = 5.11b V3               = 5.11c V4               = 5.11d V5               = 5.12a     V6               = 5.12b V7               = 5.12c V8               = 5.12d V9               = 5.13a V10             = 5.13b   V11             = 5.13c V12             = 5.13d V13             = 5.14a V14             = 5.14b V15             = 5.14c V16             = 5.14d V17             = 5.15a V18             = 5.15b V19             = 5.15c V20             = 5.15d V21             = 5.16a
